channel.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
channel.description:
Discuss game elements you feel should/n't be built into an [RPG] game.
Examples:
[ul][li]Cut scenes[/li] [li]Fighting[/li] [li]Character Development[/li] [li]Audience base[/li] [li]Age group[/li] [li]Length[/li] [li]Multiplayer[/li] [li]Secrets[/li] [li]Cheat Codes[/li][/ul]

item.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:14, topic:411375”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=512637.msg3728236#msg3728236 date=1314449293]
Zelda : A Link To The Past but in a sandbox mmorpg environment.

Enough said.
[/quote]
Collect a team and do it.
Let people build their own areas/temples/dungeons on given areas to have a growing world.[/quote]
Sounds like an epic game, would love to help if possible!

PS: I love it when RPGs have some self-reflecting humor in it, see for example M’aiq the Liar in Elder Scrolls and games like Cthulhu Saves The World!

Read full topic

item.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:11, topic:411375”]Zelda : A Link To The Past but in a sandbox mmorpg environment.

Enough said.[/quote]
Collect a team and do it.
Let people build their own areas/temples/dungeons on given areas to have a growing world.

Read full topic

item.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

I’ve never seen cheat codes in a multiplayer RPG, nonetheless support them.

Read full topic

item.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I dunno, maybe I’m naive but I don’t see cheats working in a roleplaying game. Really, any game that is multiplayer means cheats give an unfair advantage. If it was single player, that’d be a different story.

Read full topic

item.description:

Zelda : A Link To The Past but in a sandbox mmorpg environment.

item.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
item.dc:creator: @Erj Erj
item.description:
@Erj wrote:

Cheats should be a reward. Something you earn after many quests and trials.

Well I’ve been thinking about an 2D RPG Game that has many quests and contains many dialogue paths. Kind of like TES4: Oblivion’s quest system meets Dragon Age: Origin’s dynamic conversation system. I’d like to develop a game with these possibilities, but also have a “portable” version of it as well. Like an Android Game App or iOS game of some sort.

I’m currently studying Java, and hope that I can move on to Android App development as soon as possible. If any of you guys are interested, I can provide some 2D RPG sprites (From the great fan creators of the RPG Maker VX series/RPG Maker 2k3 series); which includes Character Sets, Character Face Creator, MANY Inventory Icon images, and I can also direct you guys to a site that has many Video Game’s Original Soundtracks up for grabs.

Read full topic

item.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Any game with cheat codes must contain the Konami Code in some way.

Read full topic

item.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

I was hoping that people would discuss the elements I mentioned above. Currently they are discussing Cheat Codes. They can move to a different element in RPG specifically or they can create a similar thread for a different genre such as Military (CoD or BF).

Read full topic

item.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I feel like this is going to take away from other people creating threads to discuss these ideas further :L

Read full topic

item.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“sp11k3t3ht3rd, post:4, topic:411375”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=512637.msg3720833#msg3720833 date=1313924014]

Cut scenes
Fighting
Multiplayer
Secrets
Cheat Codes

Honestly, I don’t support cheat codes but there is always a player base (if your rpg requires things that take up a lot of time) that needs a shortened game. Of course, developers always should built negatives to using cheat codes.
[/quote]

Cheat codes can be of some use. If you’ve ever played Oblivion and had to do the quest Aid for Bruma, I think there is a cheat or a mod that lets you close oblivion gates when you enter them. It’s just helpful considering you have to close 8 gates I think. Closing those 8 gates isn’t fun, its just annoying.[/quote]
`CloseCurrentOblivionGate
but I personally don’t like cheat codes. I only used them in the dev console after I beat the game just to see what I could do, and man was that fun.

Also got to the Testing Hall in Xbox360 version c:

Read full topic

item.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Lol oblivion doesn’t have cheat codes, they were given the developer console. Pretty big difference

Read full topic

item.title: [RPG] Form all ideas here!
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:3, topic:411375”][quote author=dain bramage link=topic=512637.msg3720831#msg3720831 date=1313923904]
Cut scenes
Fighting
Multiplayer
Secrets
Cheat Codes

[/quote]

Honestly, I don’t support cheat codes but there is always a player base (if your rpg requires things that take up a lot of time) that needs a shortened game. Of course, developers always should built negatives to using cheat codes.[/quote]

Cheat codes can be of some use. If you’ve ever played Oblivion and had to do the quest Aid for Bruma, I think there is a cheat or a mod that lets you close oblivion gates when you enter them. It’s just helpful considering you have to close 8 gates I think. Closing those 8 gates isn’t fun, its just annoying.

Read full topic
